alert.note: Alert for Greenville; Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 03 at 9:36AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Northern Greenville and Spartanburg Counties in Upstate South Carolina. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 935 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Localized areas of minor flooding are expected along tributaries of the South Pacolet River and Middle Tyger River in northern Greenville and Spartanburg Counties. In particular, ponding or minor flooding is expected in areas near Ponder Lane, S Barton Road, Hawkins Road, and Howe Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Landrum, Campobello, Lake Robinson, Tigerville, Lake Bowen, Pleasant Ridge State Park, Gowensville, Glassy Mountain, North Saluda Reservoir and Fingerville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
